sect2.title: SAP Product Installation
sect2.para: After applying the configuration settings, you are prompted to continue with the SAP Product Installation using the SAP Installation Wizard. The SAP Installation Wizard will install the SAP application from the SAP media kits you received from SAP.

tip.title: SAP Product Installation Default Settings
tip.para: The SAP Product Installation default settings are specified and documented in /etc/sysconfig/sap-installation-wizard. You can change them according to your needs.

step.para: Select Create SAP file systems and start SAP product installation and confirm the pop-up (see ) if you want to continue with the installation right away.

Otherwise, it is possible to just prepare the SAP product installation with Only create SAP HANA + B1 file systems, do not install SAP products now, or completely interrupt the installation process at this point with Finish wizard and proceed to OS login and resume it after a system restart.

tip.title: Resuming SAP Installation after System Restart
tip.para: To resume the SAP installation with the wizard, start &yast; and select the SAP Product Installer (Computer, then in the YaST Control Center click MiscellaneousSAP Product Installer; see ). The functionality is the same, but the layout of the dialogs is different; the left progress pane is only displayed when continuing with the installation without a restart.
The following screen shots document the installation with the SAP Product Installer that runs after a restart of the system.

step.para: In the next dialog provide the Location of the SAP Installation Master; see . The location could be a local source (either directory (dir://), locally connected hard disk (device://), USB mass storage (usb://), or CD-ROM (cdrom://)), or a remotely provided installation source (either NFS (nfs://) or SMB (smb://))—select the corresponding option from the pull-down list on the left.

tip.title: Remote Location Specification
tip.para: Peter V. is asked to provide info about SMB and ISO. If you want to install from an NFS source, you must enter the name of the server and the complete path to the media data.

step.para: For more information about setting up a remote installation server, see the &sls; 12 &deploy;, Section 14.2, Setting Up the Server Holding the Installation Sources (the &deploy; comes with the product or is available from ).

To save time and space, you can also loop mount ISO images on the installation server. For more information, see the &sls; 12 &deploy;, Section 14.2.6, Using ISO Images of the Installation Media on the Server.

figure.title: SAP Installation Wizard: SAP Installation Master Location

step.para: In the next dialog you can select the SAP products you want to install. The offerings of available products depend on the media set and installation master you received from SAP; for example, see .

For example, select Enhancement Package 5 for SAP ERP and click Next. Now the relevant part of the SAP media will be copied to the hard drive of the machine for the following SAP installation (after copying, see the contents of /data/SAP_CDs; the layout is explained later in this chapter). This is repeated for all necessary SAP media, with some additional simple questions.
After copying the Installation Master Media, as step 2 enter the location of the database medium (e.g., the SAP MaxDB RDBMS); see for an NFS installation example.

figure.title: SAP Installation: Location of the Database Medium

step.para: Now you must provide the medium with the application server framework. As step 3 you are asked for the Path to a Kernel or Java Medium. For example, if you want to install an ABAP-based system, provide the SAP Kernel for NW70 EHP1 Linux; see for an NFS installation example.

figure.title: SAP Installation: Path to a Kernel or Java Medium

step.para: As step 4 for the Type of Installation, select Central Installation; see .
As step 5 enter the location of the Export Media (e.g., the SAP CRM Installation Export DVD); see for an NFS installation example.

figure.title: SAP Installation: Location of the Export Media

step.para: If needed, add the additional export media when installation wizard asks about it.

Then you can then copy a CryptoAddOn medium; this is optional. Generally, the encryption feature depends on the SAP product.
Starting with SAP NetWeaver 7.03/7.3 the cryptographic functionality is already included in the SAP NetWeaver DVDs and does not have to be specified separately. If the wizard asks you to insert the medium containing the cryptographic functionality, see the on how to obtain the encryption files.
At this point, all data required for the SAP installation is selected and copied to /data/SAP_CDs/0, one directory per medium:

step.para: Each time you start the installation process again, a new directory will be created with a higher number (/data/SAP_CDs/0, /data/SAP_CDs/1, /data/SAP_CDs/2, etc.):
step.screen: /data/SAP_CDs/1: total 16 drwxr-xr-x 4 root root 4096 Sep 27 14:07 ./ drwxr-xr-x 4 root root 4096 Sep 27 14:06 ../ drwxr-xr-x 15 root root 4096 Sep 27 14:06 Instmaster/ drwxr-xr-x 4 root root 4096 Sep 27 14:07 RDBMS-ADA/
step.para: /data/SAP_CDs is the default as specified in the /etc/sysconfig/sap-installation-wizard configuration file.
In the following configuration dialogs, enter the details for the SAP installation.

In , as SID (SAP System ID) enter the three letter SAP System ID such as ERP. Enter the SAP Instance Number. Enter and repeat the SAP Master Password, which must fulfill the requirements described in the help text. Finally, specify the System T-Shirt-Sizing. The SAP SCS Instance Number is only required for Java installations. For details, see the online help on the left.
In , enter the virtual network settings, if needed.
In , select the the database log mode, and—if needed—install the SAP Cryptographic Library. Provide the location of the Crypto Add-On medium, if the wizard asks for it.
At this stage it is possible to install a Supplement Medium; see . For more information about a Supplement Media, see .

&sles4sap; &productnumber; is delivered with the Linux Kernel 3.0. If the SAP Kernel does not support Linux Kernel 3.0 yet, a pop-up dialog () will inform you about the activation of a compatibility mode, which will make sure that you can still install your SAP product.

As the last step of the installation procedure, you can prepare the installation of another SAP product, if wanted. If you confirm that you wish to install an additional product, the installation procedure will enter into a new iteration and restart the installation process beginning with to set up an additional product.

Now all installation data (media and settings) is available to the wizard, and the final deployment of the SAP system can take place with the SAP installer (SAPinst). The SAP installer displays a visualization of the installation steps it performs; see .

note.title: Installation Progress
note.para: Depending on your machine, it takes a while until the SAPinst tool shows up.

sect2.para: After the SAP installer has finished, you will see a short summary of the installation data.
